newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Tuesday issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and are annual percentage rates.
Turnover fell to 2.1 billion yuan from 2.5 billion yuan on Monday, with the seven-day contract the most active.
Traders said turnover fell today with many big institutions no longer in the market following last week's heavy demand for funds to meet obligations before the end of the year.

They said the market widely expected the central bank to cut bank interest rates in the first half of next year due to falling inflation and that this prevented many institutions from build longer-term positions.
Officials with the central bank have declined to comment.
Traders expect the rates to move narrowly in early 1997.
